Critical apparatus

Music
Sources Comment
Vin1587 dotted M g4 instead of f4; (I-Vnm copy only, in all other consulted copies, the g4 is clearly corrected to an f4)
Vin1587 M d4 corrected by erasion and reprinting, except for I-Bc and GB-Obl(?) where the correction is done with a pasted cutout
Gar1605 Sm rest missing
1590-29 first note (a4) dotted Sm instead of F
Vin1587 first note (a4) dotted Sm instead of F
Vin 1587 proportion sign 2/3, except in the B partbook of the F-Pn copy, where the proportion sign is 3/2
Gar1593, Sco 1603 proportion sign 3/2, later erased and corrected in C
Vin1587 last note (e4) added later in all copies
Vin1587 – dotted M g4 instead of f4; (I-Vnm copy only, in all other consulted copies, the g4 is clearly corrected to an f4)
Vin1587 – M d4 corrected by erasion and reprinting, except for I-Bc and GB-Obl(?) where the correction is done with a pasted cutout
Gar1605 – Sm rest missing
1590-29 – first note (a4) dotted Sm instead of F
Vin1587 – first note (a4) dotted Sm instead of F
Vin 1587 – proportion sign 2/3, except in the B partbook of the F-Pn copy, where the proportion sign is 3/2
Gar1593, Sco 1603 – proportion sign 3/2, later erased and corrected in C
Vin1587 – last note (e4) added later in all copies

Gar1593, Sco1603, Gar1605 – C

 erroneous repetition at the end of the phrase 'fra le due fa terzo fra le', instead of the correct 'o fra le due fa terzo Amor'

Text

Edition of the text and commentary

Di nettare amoroso ebro la mente / Sonar le labra, e vi restaro i segni
Torquato Tasso
Sonetto: ABBA ABBA CDE CDE

(Prima parte)
Di nettare amoroso ebro la mente
Ratto fui, né so come, in chiusa chiostra,
E due belle d’amor guerrier’in giostra
Vidi con l’arme ond’egli è sì possente.

Vidi ch’in dolce arringo alteramente
Fer pria di lor beltà leggiadra mostra,
Poi, movendosi incontra ove s’inostra
La bocca, si ferir di bacio ardente.

(Seconda parte)
Sonar le labra, e vi restaro i segni
Di colpi impressi. Amor, deh, perché a vòto
Tant’arme e tai percosse usar da scherzo?

Provinsi in vera pugna, e non si sdegni
Scontro d’amante. Amor, me tuo devoto
Opponi all’una, o fra le due fa terzo.

Sources used for collation

Vin1587, Am1587, Gar1593, Sco1603, Gar1605.

Comments

Contemporary editions

Rime del signor Torquato Tasso. Parte prima. […], Venezia, Manuzio, 1581, p. 63.

http://reader.digitale-sammlungen.de/de/fs1/object/display/bsb10190145_00091.html

Notes

The Marenzio and the Tasso 1581 versions correspond, thus the composer could have derived his text from the print. In Vin1587, copy of I-Vnm only, “T. Tasso” is added by hand on the upper margin. For the use of the Aldine edition by Marenzio, see also the notes to n. 12.
